00018 template<typename SRC, typename DST> void numeric_convert_impl( const SRC *src, DST *dst, size_t count, double scale, double offset )
00019 {
00020     LOG( Runtime, info )
00021             << "using generic scaling convert " << TypePtr<SRC>::staticName() << "=>" << TypePtr<DST>::staticName()
00022             << " with scale/offset " << std::fixed << scale << "/" << offset;
00023     static boost::numeric::converter <
00024     DST, double,
00025        boost::numeric::conversion_traits<DST, double>,
00026        boost::numeric::def_overflow_handler,
00027        boost::numeric::RoundEven<double>
00028        > converter;
00029 
00030     for ( size_t i = 0; i < count; i++ ) {
00031         dst[i] = converter( src[i] * scale + offset );
00032     }
00033 }
00034 
00035 template<typename SRC, typename DST> void numeric_convert_impl( const SRC *src, DST *dst, size_t count )
00036 {
00037     LOG( Runtime, info ) << "using generic convert " << TypePtr<SRC>::staticName() << " => " << TypePtr<DST>::staticName() << " without scaling";
00038     static boost::numeric::converter <
00039     DST, SRC,
00040        boost::numeric::conversion_traits<DST, SRC>,
00041        boost::numeric::def_overflow_handler,
00042        boost::numeric::RoundEven<SRC>
00043        > converter;
00044 
00045     for ( size_t i = 0; i < count; i++ )
00046         dst[i] = converter( src[i] );
00047 }

00171 
00189 template<typename SRC, typename DST> std::pair<double, double>
00190 getNumericScaling( const util::_internal::TypeBase &min, const util::_internal::TypeBase &max, autoscaleOption scaleopt = autoscale )
00191 {
00192     double scale = 1.0;
00193     double offset = 0.0;
00194     bool doScale = ( scaleopt != noscale && std::numeric_limits<DST>::is_integer ); //only do scale if scaleopt!=noscale and the target is an integer (scaling into float is useless)
00195 
00196     if ( scaleopt == autoscale && std::numeric_limits<SRC>::is_integer ) {
00197         LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Won't upscale, because the source datatype is discrete (" << util::Type<SRC>::staticName() << ")";
00198         scaleopt = noupscale; //dont scale up if SRC is an integer
00199     }
00200 
00201     if ( doScale ) {
00202         const DST domain_min = std::numeric_limits<DST>::min();//negative value domain of this dst
00203         const DST domain_max = std::numeric_limits<DST>::max();//positive value domain of this dst
00204         double minval, maxval;
00205         minval = min.as<double>();
00206         maxval = max.as<double>();
00207         assert( minval < maxval );
00208         LOG( Debug, info ) << "src Range:" << minval << "=>" << maxval;
00209         LOG( Debug, info ) << "dst Domain:" << domain_min << "=>" << domain_max;
00210         assert( domain_min < domain_max );//we also should assume this
00211         //set offset for src
00212         //if all src is completly on positive domain, or if there is no negative domain use minval
00213         //else if src is completly on negative dmain, or if there is no positive domain use maxval
00214         //elsewise leave it at 0 and scale both sides
00215         if ( minval > 0 || !domain_min ) {
00216             if ( ( maxval - domain_max ) > 0 ) // if the values completely fit into the domain we dont have to offset them
00217                 offset = -minval;
00218         } else if ( ( 0 - maxval ) > 0 || !domain_max ) {
00219             if ( ( domain_min - minval ) > 0  ) // if the values completely fit into the domain we dont have to offset them
00220                 offset = -maxval;
00221         }
00222 
00223         //calculate range of values which will be on postive/negative domain when offset is applied
00224         const double range_max = maxval + offset; //allways >=0
00225         const double range_min = minval + offset; //allways <=0
00226         //set scaling factor to fit src-range into dst domain
00227         //some compilers dont make x/0 = inf, so we use std::numeric_limits<double>::max() instead, in this case
00228         const double scale_max =
00229             range_max != 0 ? domain_max / range_max :
00230             std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
00231         const double scale_min =
00232             range_min != 0 ? domain_min / range_min :
00233             std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
00234         scale = std::min( scale_max ? scale_max : std::numeric_limits<double>::max(), scale_min ? scale_min : std::numeric_limits<double>::max() );//get the smaller scaling factor which is not zero so the bigger range will fit into his domain
00235 
00236         if ( scale < 1 ) {
00237             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Downscaling your values by Factor " << scale << " you might lose information.";
00238         } else if ( scaleopt == noupscale ) {
00239             if ( scale > 1 ) {
00240                 LOG( Runtime, info ) << "upscale not given, clamping scale " << scale << " to 1";
00241                 scale = 1;
00242             }
00243         }
00244 
00245         offset *= scale;//calc offset for dst
00246     }
00247 
00248     return std::make_pair( scale, offset );
00249 }
00250 
00266 template<typename SRC, typename DST> void numeric_convert( const TypePtr<SRC> &src, TypePtr<DST> &dst, const double scale, const double offset )
00267 {
00268     LOG_IF( src.len() > dst.len(), Runtime, error ) << "The " << src.len() << " elements of src wont fit into the destination. Will only convert " << dst.len() << " elements.";
00269     LOG_IF( src.len() < dst.len(), Runtime, warning ) << "Source is shorter than destination. Will only convert " << src.len() << " values";
00270 
00271     if ( src.len() == 0 )return;
00272 
00273     const size_t size = std::min( src.len(), dst.len() );
00274 
00275     if ( ( scale != 1. || offset ) )
00276         _internal::numeric_convert_impl( &src[0], &dst[0], size, scale, offset );
00277     else
00278         _internal::numeric_convert_impl( &src[0], &dst[0], size );
00279 }
00280
